alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Forsyth and south central Dawson Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 439 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Silver City, or near Dawsonville, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, pea sized hail, frequent lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cumming, Dougherty, Matt, Silver City, Chestatee, Oscarville and Coal Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
